Description: Fragment of double arched handle and shoulder of East Greek grey ware pottery vessel, krater or hydria; interior reserved; exterior: very worn dark grey slip; handles largely missing, with only central join with wall remaining; plastic decoration between handles consisting of probable bud.
Curator's comments: Fragment is similar to British Museum 1965,0930.439 and 1888,0601.647.c. In the same style is the handle fragment of a jug or hydria found on Samos (Walter-Karydi, ‘Samos - VI/1 Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts v. Chr.’, (Deutsches Archäologisches Institut), Bonn (1973), pl. 60, no. 497, with volute palmette in relief).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.099)
